snippet: When Harris Lirtzman warned his principal that their Bronx school was violating the rights of special needs students, he lost his job, but the State Education Department now says he was right.
abstract: Michael Powell Gotham column on Bronx school teacher Harris Lirtzman, who lost his job after warning his principal that chool was violating the rights of special needs students; New York State Education Department investigated the charges, ultimately vindicating Lirtzman, but he had already chosen to retire.
lead_paragraph: When Harris Lirtzman warned his principal that their Bronx school was violating the rights of special needs students, he lost his job, but the State Education Department now says he was right.

headline.seo: State Backs Up Accusation by Harris Lirtzman, Bronx Teacher, on Special Education - Gotham
headline.main: On Special Education, Spurned Teacher Is Vindicated
